raw: * The grid layout manager arranges the items in a two dimensional
* grid. Widgets can be placed into the grid's cells and may span multiple rows
* * Flex values for rows and columns
* * Minimal and maximal column and row sizes
* * Manually setting of column and row sizes

*
  • row (Integer): The row of the cell the
*   widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout

*
  • column (Integer): The column of the cell the
*   widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout
* widget should span, starting from the row specified in the row
*   property. The cells in the spanned rows must be empty as well.
* widget should span, starting from the column specified in the column
*   property. The cells in the spanned columns must be empty as well.
* Here is a little example of how to use the grid layout.
* layout.setColumnWidth(1, 200); // set with of column 1 to 200 pixel
* Extended documentation and links to demos of this layout in the qooxdoo manual.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The grid layout manager arranges the items in a two dimensional grid. Widgets can be placed into the grid's cells and may span multiple rows and columns. Features

  • Flex values for rows and columns
  • Minimal and maximal column and row sizes
  • Manually setting of column and row sizes
  • Horizontal and vertical alignment
  • Horizontal and vertical spacing
  • Column and row spans

  • Auto-sizing Item Properties

  • row (Integer): The row of the cell the widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout property is mandatory.
  • column (Integer): The column of the cell the widget should occupy. Each cell can only containing one widget. This layout property is mandatory.
  • rowSpan (Integer): The number of rows, the widget should span, starting from the row specified in the row property. The cells in the spanned rows must be empty as well.
  • colSpan (Integer): The number of columns, the widget should span, starting from the column specified in the column property. The cells in the spanned columns must be empty as well.

Example Here is a little example of how to use the grid layout. 

 var layout = new qx.ui.layout.Grid();
 layout.setRowFlex(0, 1);
 layout.setColumnWidth(1, 200);
 var container = new qx.ui.container.Composite(layout);
 container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 0, column: 0});
 container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 0, column: 1});
 container.add(new qx.ui.core.Widget(), {row: 1, column: 0, rowSpan: 2});

External Documentation Extended documentation and links to demos of this layout in the qooxdoo manual.

raw: * The horizontal spacing between grid cells.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The horizontal spacing between grid cells.

raw: * The vertical spacing between grid cells.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The vertical spacing between grid cells.

raw: * Allow growing of spanning cells' widths beyond the accumulated widths of the columns.
* The default behavior (init value false) is that the width of the spanning cell is
* determined by the accumulated width of the columns (plus spacing).
* Setting this property to true lets the cell width grow as needed to show
* the widget in the spanning cell, which also enlarges the width of the spanned columns.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Allow growing of spanning cells' widths beyond the accumulated widths of the columns. The default behavior (init value false) is that the width of the spanning cell is determined by the accumulated width of the columns (plus spacing). Setting this property to true lets the cell width grow as needed to show the widget in the spanning cell, which also enlarges the width of the spanned columns.

raw: * Set the default cell alignment for a column. This alignment can be
* overridden on a per cell basis by setting the cell's content widget's
* If on a grid cell both row and a column alignment is set, the horizontal
* alignment is taken from the column and the vertical alignment is taken
* @param hAlign {String} The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
* @param vAlign {String} The vertical alignment. Valid values are

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the default cell alignment for a column. This alignment can be overridden on a per cell basis by setting the cell's content widget's alignX and alignY properties. If on a grid cell both row and a column alignment is set, the horizontal alignment is taken from the column and the vertical alignment is taken from the row.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hAlign {String} The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
    "left", "center" and "right".
@param.description:
The horizontal alignment. Valid values are
    "left", "center" and "right".

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
vAlign {String} The vertical alignment. Valid values are
    "top", "middle", "bottom"
@param.description:
The vertical alignment. Valid values are
    "top", "middle", "bottom"

@return.name: @return

@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal column alignment.

raw: * Get a map of the cell's alignment. For vertical alignment the row alignment
* takes precedence over the column alignment. For horizontal alignment it is
* the over way round. If an alignment is set on the cell widget using
* always precedence over row or column alignment.
* @return {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign
*     containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a map of the cell's alignment. For vertical alignment the row alignment takes precedence over the column alignment. For horizontal alignment it is the over way round. If an alignment is set on the cell widget using {@link qx.ui.core.LayoutItem#setLayoutProperties}, this alignment takes always precedence over row or column alignment.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.
@return.description: A map with the keys vAlign and hAlign containing the vertical and horizontal cell alignment.

raw: * Check whether all row spans fit with their preferred height into the
* preferred row heights. If there is not enough space, the preferred
* row sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max
*  The same is true for the min sizes.
*  The height array is modified in place.
* @param rowHeights {Map[]} The current row height array as computed by

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether all row spans fit with their preferred height into the preferred row heights. If there is not enough space, the preferred row sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max values of the rows. The same is true for the min sizes. The height array is modified in place.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowHeights {Map[]} The current row height array as computed by
     {@link #_getRowHeights}.
@param.description:
The current row height array as computed by
     {@link #_getRowHeights}.

raw: * Check whether all col spans fit with their preferred width into the
* preferred column widths. If there is not enough space the preferred
* column sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max
*  The same is true for the min sizes.
*  The width array is modified in place.
* @param colWidths {Map[]} The current column width array as computed by

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether all col spans fit with their preferred width into the preferred column widths. If there is not enough space the preferred column sizes are increased. The distribution respects the flex and max values of the columns. The same is true for the min sizes. The width array is modified in place.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
colWidths {Map[]} The current column width array as computed by
     {@link #_getColWidths}.
@param.description:
The current column width array as computed by
     {@link #_getColWidths}.

raw: * Computes for each column by how many pixels it must grow or shrink, taking
* the column flex values and min/max widths into account.

     an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the column.

     an array entry is empty nothing should be added to the column.
